entry.title: Will you love me for who I am, not who I was?
entry.summary:
Author: Emgiehae

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 18,914Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 0

Summary: Buck doesn’t feel like himself.He hasn’t since he woke up from the coma.He doesn’t know how to explain it, and he’s pretty sure that no one would understand if he were to try. It’s just something inside of him that doesn’t feel like him.Objectively… realistically he knows what it’s about.This wasn’t a run of the mill near death situation like getting buried under mud or getting rebar through your skull. It was an actual deathHe died.That’s actually something that can happen.After all the near deaths they’ve had, after all the almosts and the mights, the tsunamis and the snipers, it happened. And it happened to him.He died, and he doesn’t know where to start to process it. Or: Buck loses sight of himself - Dr. Copeland suggests that he finds hobbies that can occupy his mind. He picks up yoga again, he goes to the zoo with Chris, and he reconnects with a part of himself that he'd left behind. With Oliplayshere making a comeback, Buck starts to heal.

entry.title: eat your bones
entry.summary:
Author: oneofthesirens

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,878Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 92

Summary: “What, even if I kill someone?” Eddie shoots back. It feels like he’s daring Buck — testing him, almost. Eddie can’t tell what he wants from this conversation, just that he wants. “Even then,” Buck says, then adds, “Especially if it's your parents.” “Buck,” Eddie laughs. His whole face feels flushed, impossibly hot. It’s hot in Texas, always, but he feels almost electric with it. “Nah, Eddie, I’m being so serious right now, if you tell me you need to hide a body in El Paso, I’m there.” Buck’s laughing too, his head thrown back so the arch of his neck takes up most of Eddie’s screen. Eddie presses a thumb to the screen, where he could touch the dip at the base of Buck’s throat if they were together. “Don’t be an idiot,” Eddie snorts. “I’m not going to ask you to hide a body, okay?” Buck sighs. “I wish you would. We’d see each other again, at least.” or: my love letter to Eddie’s Texas arc

entry.title: Tastes Like Birthday Wishes
entry.summary:
Author: Sunbleached_Diaz

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,091Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 160

Summary: “If you touch the bottom of the cake, you have to kiss the nearest boy,” she said, voice as sweet as ever.Eddie freezes, the knife in his hand already sliced through the chocolate cake, already clinking on the plate underneath it.“Huh?” Eddie’s not sure if he heard her right. He’s also not sure why he has a lump forming at the back of his throat. Probably unrelated, he tells himself.He’s looking at Jee now, who is perched on the seat nearest to Maddie.“Daddy told me and Mommy that if we touch the bottom of the cake we have to kiss the nearest boy, otherwise our birthday wishes won’t come true.”Eddie whips his head around to find Chim, who stands across the table from him, Hen and Karen by his side. He watches as something akin to joy glints in his friend’s eyes, and Eddie shoots his best ‘What The Fuck Have You Done?’ look in his direction.*Or, it's Eddie's birthday, and he wants his birthday wish to come true. If that means kissing his best friend, then he's gonna kiss his best friend. Platonically, of course.

entry.title: Guardian in the Crossfire
entry.summary:
Author: Grius

Rating: MatureLanguage: EnglishWords: 4,043Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 99

Summary: When Helena and Ramon Diaz rush to Los Angeles after learning their son Eddie was shot, they’re unprepared for the life he’s built without them. Reeling from the revelation that Evan "Buck" Buckley—a man they’ve never met—is not only Eddie’s caregiver but Christopher’s legal guardian, their attempts to reclaim their place in their son’s life unravel into a clash of generations, values, and unspoken truths.As Eddie recovers under Buck’s steadfast support, tensions ignite: Helena confronts her failures as a mother, Ramon grapples with Eddie’s bisexuality and distrust of tradition, and Christopher fiercely defends the only stability he’s ever known. With Isabel Diaz mediating and the 118 silently standing guard, the Diazes are forced to reckon with what family really means—and who gets to define it.

entry.title: just a little bit of your heart (is all I'm asking for)
entry.summary:
Author: dbolterstar

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 116,740Chapters: 14/?Kudos: 117

Summary: “Does this change a thing between us?” Buck asks, his voice low, his hands still framing Eddie’s face. He can feel the unsteady breaths leaving Eddie’s lips, warm against his own. Eddie looks wrecked. His cheeks are flushed, lips red and kiss-swollen, his glassy eyes locked on Buck’s mouth like it’s the only thing he can see. He looks as hungry as Buck feels. Buck feels Eddie’s fingers trace along his arms, squeezing just enough to leave his skin tingling. “I don’t know.” It’s not a yes—Buck’s not even sure he wants to hear a yes. But it’s so much better than the rejection Eddie threw at him before. “Alright,” Buck exhales, nodding like it’s nothing, even though it feels massive. Then he surges forward, catching Eddie’s mouth in his again. The soft, desperate sound Eddie lets out—like relief and need tangled together—hits Buck like a punch to the chest. or; Eddie’s shame torments him. Buck would rather have a piece of Eddie than nothing at all. Miscommunication is their biggest enemy. Infidelity turns into their savior… or ends up being the thing that destroys them?

entry.title: Love From the Other Side
entry.summary:
Author: betweensaintsandsinners

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 10,218Chapters: 3/?Kudos: 34

Summary: Buck nodded to himself, the clicking of the keyboard a soft lull as he worked on editing his photos. It was almost comforting sound, like rain against glass, softly pattering as it fell. The silence lingered between them, but it wasn’t uncomfortable or heavy. Every now and then, Buck would pause to take a drink of water or he could hear Eddie’s quiet movements, but neither of them moved from their spots against the wall, making sure the other could hear them in the vent if they were to speak.After around three or four minutes, Eddie was the one who broke the silence, his voice thicker with sleep. Buck wasn’t even sure if the man was fully awake now. “We should probably try and get some sleep, I have to take Chris to school in the morning and then a shift. What do you say we do this again tomorrow night? Same place and time?”—————————Or an AU where Eddie is still a firefighter for the LAFD and has trouble sleeping at night, his neighbor Buck is a photographer with social anxiety who likes to stay inside most of the time.The vent between their apartments allow them to talk late at night when neither can sleep.

entry.title: This is me trying (to come home to you)
entry.summary:
Author: Sajsulawske

Rating: ExplicitLanguage: EnglishWords: 13,362Chapters: 8/?Kudos: 32

Summary: “Eddie, you cannot take him from here. He has a life here. He belongs here...” For a moment I don’t realize what she is saying. I’m not taking Chris away from El Paso.“...With us” It feels like a punch to the gut. She wants to take my son away from me… Again. I freeze. I feel my fist clench and my jaw tighten. Not again they cannot and will not take my son from me.“Even if something happened to me he wouldn’t stay with you!” The words feel like they have been ripped from my very soul.Eddie Diaz struggles with his feelings. This is a fix-it fic of 8x14 to the end of season 8.Such a large part of me (Sami) wants to close up a lot of loss ends that the show has left untouched. Especially Eddie's grief and guilt surrounding Shannon. I also will not be making this about Shannon Slander. I think Eddie has every right to be angry with her but Shannon is also human and deserved to be loved by someone.

entry.title: It's Freaking Me Out That You're Not Freaking Out
entry.summary:
Author: carpediaz

Rating: General AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 736Chapters: 1/1Kudos: 170

Summary: Buck sighs, gulping down the rest of his beer to try to find the right words to say. He doesn’t find them at the bottom of the bottle, but what he does find is the courage to be a total fucking idiot. He puts his empty bottle down and closes the remaining distance between him and Eddie, grabbing his face with both hands and drawing him into a kiss that blasts past the platonic line they’ve been toeing in their friendship from day one.orThe one where Buck freaks out because Eddie isn't freaking out.
